abstract: All but three residents of Falkland Islands vote in favor of remaining under British rule; Argentina, which says it has historic claim to islands, dismisses referendum as meaningless stunt.
lead_paragraph: All but three voters in the Falkland Islands cast ballots in favor of maintaining British rule, but Argentina, which claims the islands, dismissed the referendum as a meaningless stunt.

byline.contributor: Emily Schmall contributed reporting from Buenos Aires.

headline.main: Voters in Falklands Back British Rule Nearly Unanimously
headline.print_headline: Voters in Falklands Back British Rule Nearly Unanimously
headline.seo: Falklands Voters Back British Rule Nearly Unanimously

snippet: All but three voters in the Falkland Islands cast ballots in favor of maintaining British rule, but Argentina, which claims the islands, dismissed the referendum as a meaningless stunt....
